verses.verse: For the Chief Musician. A Psalm of David. O Jehovah <S%H3068><s%>, thou hast searched <S%H2713><s%> me <S%H3045><s%>, and known me.
Thou knowest <S%H3045><s%> my downsitting <S%H3427><s%> and mine uprising <S%H6965><s%>; Thou understandest <S%H995><s%> my thought <S%H7454><s%> afar off <S%H7350><s%>.
Thou searchest <S%H2219><s%> out my path <S%H734><s%> and my lying down <S%H7252><s%>, And art acquainted <S%H5532><s%> with all my ways <S%H1870><s%>.
For there is not a word <S%H4405><s%> in my tongue <S%H3956><s%>, But <S%H3068><s%>, lo, O Jehovah, thou knowest it altogether <S%H3045><s%>.
Thou hast beset <S%H6696><s%> me behind <S%H268><s%> and before <S%H6924><s%>, And laid <S%H7896><s%> thy hand upon me <S%H3709><s%>.
Such knowledge <S%H1847><s%> is too wonderful <S%H6383><s%> for me <S%H7682><s%>; It is high, I cannot attain unto it <S%H3201><s%>.
Whither shall I go <S%H3212><s%> from thy Spirit <S%H7307><s%>? Or whither shall I flee <S%H1272><s%> from thy presence <S%H6440><s%>?
If I ascend up <S%H5266><s%> into heaven <S%H8064><s%>, thou art there <S%H3331><s%>: If I make my bed in Sheol <S%H7585><s%>, behold, thou art there.
If I take <S%H5375><s%> the wings <S%H3671><s%> of the morning <S%H7837><s%>, And dwell <S%H7931><s%> in the uttermost parts <S%H319><s%> of the sea <S%H3220><s%>;
Even there shall thy hand <S%H3027><s%> lead <S%H5148><s%> me <S%H3225><s%>, And thy right hand shall hold me <S%H270><s%>.
If I say <S%H559><s%>, Surely the darkness <S%H2822><s%> shall overwhelm <S%H7779><s%> me <S%H216><s%>, And the light about me <S%H1157><s%> shall be night <S%H3915><s%>;

Even the darkness <S%H2822><s%> hideth <S%H2821><s%> not from thee <S%H3915><s%>, But the night shineth <S%H215><s%> as the day <S%H3117><s%>: The darkness <S%H2825><s%> and the light are both alike to thee <S%H219><s%>.
For thou didst form <S%H7069><s%> my inward <S%H3629><s%> parts <S%H5526><s%>: Thou didst cover me in my mother <S%H517><s%>'s womb <S%H990><s%>.

I will give thanks <S%H3034><s%> unto thee <S%H3372><s%>; For I am fearfully and wonderfully made <S%H6395><s%>: Wonderful <S%H6381><s%> are thy works <S%H4639><s%>; And that my soul <S%H5315><s%> knoweth <S%H3045><s%> right well <S%H3966><s%>.

My frame <S%H6108><s%> was not hidden <S%H3582><s%> from thee <S%H6213><s%>, When I was made in secret <S%H5643><s%>, And curiously wrought <S%H7551><s%> in the lowest parts <S%H8482><s%> of the earth <S%H776><s%>.

Thine eyes <S%H5869><s%> did see <S%H7200><s%> mine unformed <S%H1564><s%> substance <S%H5612><s%>; And in thy book they were all written <S%H3789><s%>, Even the days <S%H3117><s%> that were ordained <S%H3335><s%> for me <S%H259><s%>, When as yet there was none of them.
How precious <S%H3365><s%> also are thy thoughts <S%H7454><s%> unto me <S%H410><s%>, O God! How great <S%H6105><s%> is the sum of them <S%H7218><s%>!
If I should count <S%H5608><s%> them <S%H7235><s%>, they are more in number than the sand <S%H2344><s%>: When I awake <S%H6974><s%>, I am still with thee <S%H5750><s%>.
Surely thou wilt slay <S%H6991><s%> the wicked <S%H7563><s%>, O God <S%H433><s%>: Depart <S%H5493><s%> from me therefore <S%H1818><s%>, ye bloodthirsty men <S%H582><s%>.
For they speak <S%H559><s%> against thee wickedly <S%H4209><s%>, And thine enemies <S%H6145><s%> take <S%H5375><s%> thy name in vain <S%H7723><s%>.
Do not I hate <S%H8130><s%> them <S%H3068><s%>, O Jehovah, that hate <S%H8130><s%> thee <S%H6962><s%>? And am not I grieved with those that rise up against thee <S%H8618><s%>?
I hate <S%H8130><s%> them with perfect <S%H8503><s%> hatred <S%H8135><s%>: They are become mine enemies <S%H341><s%>.
Search <S%H2713><s%> me <S%H410><s%>, O God, and know <S%H3045><s%> my heart <S%H3824><s%>: Try <S%H974><s%> me <S%H3045><s%>, and know my thoughts <S%H8312><s%>;
And see <S%H7200><s%> if there be any wicked <S%H6090><s%> way <S%H1870><s%> in me <S%H5148><s%>, And lead me in the way <S%H1870><s%> everlasting <S%H5769><s%>.
